fields.summary: [Python] Continuation of improving Classes and Methods Docstrings

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
pitrou commented on code in PR #13595:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13595#discussion_r920100720


##########
python/pyarrow/_fs.pyx:
##########
@@ -1027,6 +1027,23 @@ cdef class PyFileSystem(FileSystem):
     ----------
     handler : FileSystemHandler
         The handler object implementing custom filesystem behavior.
+
+    Examples
+    --------
+    Create an fsspec-based filesystem object for Google Cloud Storage:

Review Comment:
   Also, for the record, we now have a native GCS filesystem class, so I don't know if this is a great example.
   There is a [list of built-in fsspec implementations](https://filesystem-spec.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#built-in-implementations) to choose from, a nice one could perhaps be the Github filesystem?



##########
python/pyarrow/_fs.pyx:
##########
@@ -1027,6 +1027,23 @@ cdef class PyFileSystem(FileSystem):
     ----------
     handler : FileSystemHandler
         The handler object implementing custom filesystem behavior.
+
+    Examples
+    --------
+    Create an fsspec-based filesystem object for Google Cloud Storage:

Review Comment:
   Looks like this fails the CI documentation tests as `gcsfs` isn't installed.

AlenkaF commented on code in PR #13595:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13595#discussion_r920384094


##########
python/pyarrow/_fs.pyx:
##########
@@ -1027,6 +1027,23 @@ cdef class PyFileSystem(FileSystem):
     ----------
     handler : FileSystemHandler
         The handler object implementing custom filesystem behavior.
+
+    Examples
+    --------
+    Create an fsspec-based filesystem object for Google Cloud Storage:

Review Comment:
   Awesome, Github filesystem will be a great example. Thanks!!
   And sorry for asking for review before waiting for the CI to finish - was a bit too sure of myself =)

jorisvandenbossche commented on code in PR #13595:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13595#discussion_r921896331


##########
python/pyarrow/_fs.pyx:
##########
@@ -1027,6 +1027,23 @@ cdef class PyFileSystem(FileSystem):
     ----------
     handler : FileSystemHandler
         The handler object implementing custom filesystem behavior.
+
+    Examples
+    --------
+    Create an fsspec-based filesystem object for GitHub:
+
+    >>> from fsspec.implementations import github
+    >>> gfs = github.GithubFileSystem('apache', 'arrow')
+
+    Get a PyArrow FileSystem object:
+
+    >>> from pyarrow.fs import PyFileSystem, FSSpecHandler
+    >>> pa_fs = PyFileSystem(FSSpecHandler(gfs))
+
+    Use :func:`~pyarrow.fs.FileSystem` functionality `get_file_info()`:

Review Comment:
   ```suggestion
       Use :func:`~pyarrow.fs.FileSystem` functionality ``get_file_info()``:
   ```

AlenkaF commented on code in PR #13595:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13595#discussion_r921970909


##########
python/pyarrow/_fs.pyx:
##########
@@ -1027,6 +1027,23 @@ cdef class PyFileSystem(FileSystem):
     ----------
     handler : FileSystemHandler
         The handler object implementing custom filesystem behavior.
+
+    Examples
+    --------
+    Create an fsspec-based filesystem object for GitHub:
+
+    >>> from fsspec.implementations import github
+    >>> gfs = github.GithubFileSystem('apache', 'arrow')
+
+    Get a PyArrow FileSystem object:
+
+    >>> from pyarrow.fs import PyFileSystem, FSSpecHandler
+    >>> pa_fs = PyFileSystem(FSSpecHandler(gfs))
+
+    Use :func:`~pyarrow.fs.FileSystem` functionality `get_file_info()`:

Review Comment:
   I can't seem to remember to use double `` 🤦‍♀️  Thanks!

AlenkaF commented on PR #13595:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13595#issuecomment-1185641804

   The CI fail doesn't seem related.

pitrou commented on code in PR #13595:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13595#discussion_r924314647


##########
python/pyarrow/_fs.pyx:
##########
@@ -1030,20 +1030,20 @@ cdef class PyFileSystem(FileSystem):
 
     Examples
     --------
-    Create an fsspec-based filesystem object for Google Cloud Storage:
+    Create an fsspec-based filesystem object for GitHub:
 
-    >>> import gcsfs
-    >>> fs = gcsfs.GCSFileSystem(project='gcp-public-data-sentinel-2/index.csv.gz')
+    >>> from fsspec.implementations import github
+    >>> gfs = github.GithubFileSystem('apache', 'arrow')
 
     Get a PyArrow FileSystem object:
 
     >>> from pyarrow.fs import PyFileSystem, FSSpecHandler
-    >>> pa_fs = PyFileSystem(FSSpecHandler(fs))
+    >>> pa_fs = PyFileSystem(FSSpecHandler(gfs))
 
     Use :func:`~pyarrow.fs.FileSystem` functionality `get_file_info()`:
 
-    >>> pa_fs.get_file_info('gcp-public-data-sentinel-2/index.csv.gz')
-    <FileInfo for 'gcp-public-data-sentinel-2/index.csv.gz': type=FileType.File, size=2783655355>
+    >>> pa_fs.get_file_info('README.md')
+    <FileInfo for 'README.md': type=FileType.File, size=5302>

Review Comment:
   Note that if you want this test to always succeed, you should choose a specific changeset in `GithubFileSystem`.

AlenkaF commented on code in PR #13595:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13595#discussion_r924319489


##########
python/pyarrow/_fs.pyx:
##########
@@ -1030,20 +1030,20 @@ cdef class PyFileSystem(FileSystem):
 
     Examples
     --------
-    Create an fsspec-based filesystem object for Google Cloud Storage:
+    Create an fsspec-based filesystem object for GitHub:
 
-    >>> import gcsfs
-    >>> fs = gcsfs.GCSFileSystem(project='gcp-public-data-sentinel-2/index.csv.gz')
+    >>> from fsspec.implementations import github
+    >>> gfs = github.GithubFileSystem('apache', 'arrow')
 
     Get a PyArrow FileSystem object:
 
     >>> from pyarrow.fs import PyFileSystem, FSSpecHandler
-    >>> pa_fs = PyFileSystem(FSSpecHandler(fs))
+    >>> pa_fs = PyFileSystem(FSSpecHandler(gfs))
 
     Use :func:`~pyarrow.fs.FileSystem` functionality `get_file_info()`:
 
-    >>> pa_fs.get_file_info('gcp-public-data-sentinel-2/index.csv.gz')
-    <FileInfo for 'gcp-public-data-sentinel-2/index.csv.gz': type=FileType.File, size=2783655355>
+    >>> pa_fs.get_file_info('README.md')
+    <FileInfo for 'README.md': type=FileType.File, size=5302>

Review Comment:
   Will add.

pitrou commented on PR #13595:

fields.description:
Ensure docstrings for Filesystem Interface have an {{Examples}} section:
 * [https://arrow.apache.org/docs/python/generated/pyarrow.fs.PyFileSystem.html#pyarrow.fs.PyFileSystem]
 * [https://arrow.apache.org/docs/python/generated/pyarrow.fs.FileSystemHandler.html#pyarrow.fs.FileSystemHandler]
 * [https://arrow.apache.org/docs/python/generated/pyarrow.fs.FSSpecHandler.html#pyarrow.fs.FSSpecHandler]

comments.body: This issue was last updated over 90 days ago, which may be an indication it is no longer being actively worked. To better reflect the current state, the issue is being unassigned. Please feel free to re-take assignment of the issue if it is being actively worked, or if you plan to start that work soon.
